content: Add the website URL for embedding to the <1>allow list</1>.

comment.text: This translation key controls the text displayed on a button to add a website URL to an embedding allow list. It is used in the EmbeddingPanel component and prompts users to grant permission for embedding from specific websites.

usage.context:
<Text fontSize="12px" fontWeight={400}>
 {isAdmin ? (
 <Trans
 t={t as TFunction}
 ns="EmbeddingPanel"
 i18nKey="EmbeddingBarAllowList"
 components={{
 1: (
 <Link
 onClick={onOpenDevTools}
 color={currentColorScheme?.main?.accent}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "yerləşdirmə üçün" literally translates to "for placement" which isn't the most natural way to express "for embedding." A more accurate translation would be "gömülməsi üçün" or something similar.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Saytın URL-ni gömülməsi üçün <1>allow list</1> əlavə edin.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets around 'allow list' are not consistently applied. The English has <1>allow list</1>, but the Bulgarian uses '<1>списъка с разрешени</1>'. This should be consistent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change '<1>списъка с разрешени</1>' to '<1>списъка с разрешени</1>'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> are present in both the English and German, but their purpose isn't clear without further context. While technically not incorrect, they might be unnecessary and should be evaluated for removal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the <1> tags if they serve no functional purpose in the translated UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Greek translations. While technically correct, it's unusual to include this markup in a user-facing translation. It's likely a remnant of the original content management system and should be removed for clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags from the Greek translation. The sentence should read: "Προσθέστε τη διεύθυνση URL του ιστότοπου για την ενσωμάτωση στη λίστα επιτρεπόντων."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "allow list" is best translated as "lista blanca" instead of "lista de permisos." While "lista de permisos" isn't strictly incorrect, "lista blanca" is the standard and more accurate translation in this context, particularly in technical documentation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Añada la URL del sitio web para incrustarlo en la <1>lista blanca</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "allow list" is directly transliterated instead of being translated into a Finnish equivalent. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'sallittujen sivustojen listalle' or 'upotettavien sivustojen listalle'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lisää verkkosivun URL sallittujen sivustojen listalle upottamista varten.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>allow list</1>` tags are directly translated and maintained. While technically correct, this is awkward. Consider removing them or adapting the surrounding text to integrate the translated term more smoothly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lisää verkkosivun URL sallittujen sivustojen listalle upottamista varten.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets (<1> and </1>) are preserved in the French translation. They should be removed as they are part of the original English formatting and unnecessary in French.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets around 'la liste d'autorisation'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "թույլատրել ցանկում" literally translates to "in the allowed list."  A more accurate translation for "allow list" would be something like "ներկայացման թույլատրված ցանկում" (in the list of permitted presentations) or simply "թույլատրված ցանկում" (in the permitted list). The current translation feels awkward and doesn't convey the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ավելացնել վեբկայքի URL-ը ներկառուցման համար թույլատրված ցանկում

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Armenian content. While this might be for internal tracking, it's unclear why they should be included in the final user-facing translation. They should be removed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags from the Armenian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent in English and Japanese. The English uses 'allow list', while the Japanese uses the tag to highlight '許可リスト'. This makes the translation appear less natural in Japanese.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the HTML tags or standardizing the tag usage to either be used in both English and Japanese, or to use a different highlighting method appropriate for Japanese text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` should be consistent with the English version. They appear to be used for emphasis, but are not necessary for the translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets around '허용 목록'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English term "allow list" is best translated as "gepermitteerde lijst" or "goedgekeurde lijst" rather than "toestaan lijst". "Toestaan lijst" is grammatically awkward and not the standard term.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Voeg de website URL voor insluiten toe aan de <1>gepermitteerde lijst</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag <1> is inconsistent with the English content. It should be closed correctly.
The `<1>` tags are not consistently formatted. The English uses angled brackets, while the Portuguese uses angled brackets.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of angled brackets for both languages: `<1>` in the Portuguese translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in both the English and Portuguese translations. While technically not an error, they are a formatting artifact and should ideally be removed or standardized to match the UI implementation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` from the Portuguese translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "allow list" is translated as "lista de adrese web de încredere". While technically correct, it's a bit verbose and not as concise as possible. A more common and straightforward translation would be "lista de permisiuni" or "lista de încredere".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating "allow list" as "lista de permisiuni" or "lista de încredere" for better clarity and conciseness.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Romanian text, indicating they are meant to be preserved. This is fine, but worth noting for consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the `<1>` and `</1>` tags are handled consistently throughout the translation process.

ai_spell_check_issues.description:
The translation "<1>අනුමැත ලැදිස්තුවට</1> වෙබ් අඩවිය URL එක ඇතුළත් කරන්න." is not a perfect translation of "Add the website URL for embedding to the <1>allow list</1>.
Specifically, "අනුමැත ලැදිස්තුවට" (anumatha ladisthuwathaa) translates to 'to the approved list', which is slightly different from the meaning of 'allow list'.  A more accurate translation would emphasize the list's function as an allow list, rather than just 'approved'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: <1>අනුමැත කරන ලැයිස්තුවට</1> වෙබ් අඩවිය URL එක ඇතුළත් කරන්න. (Anumatha karana laayisthuwathaa veba adaviya URL ekathulath karanna.) - 'Add the website URL to the list of approved websites' is a more precise rendition.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of <1> tags appears to be intended for formatting in the original English content. The Sinhala translation should also maintain this formatting consistency, unless the UI/system using this translation doesn't support it.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure that the Sinhala translation also uses the <1> tags to match the English formatting.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is present in both the English and Slovenian text. While not strictly an error, it's inconsistent with common practice to include it in the translated text unless specifically required for UI rendering. Consider removing it from the Slovenian translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> tags from the Slovenian translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'website' is transliterated as 'wеb сајта', which while understandable, is not the most natural or preferred Serbian spelling.  'Веб сајта' would be more common.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Додајте URL веб сајта за уграђивање на <1> листу дозвољених </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are inconsistent with the English content. The English uses <1> and </1>, but the Serbian uses <1> and </1>. While technically acceptable, consistency is preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change </1> to </1> for consistency with the English content.
